page.title: 15GREEN ACRES FARM KEMBERTON
page.content: The soil at the farm is medium loam but to the south there is clay soil and to the north sandy soil. Mr Lea grows grain for 6 years then grass for 4 years. He uses chemical sprays and fertilisers to supplement his supply of manure. His grain is sold whilst standing to a Shropshire merchant. Wheat and barley are used for animal fodder and oats for human consumption. Mr Lea's farm is not typical of the area. Most farms are 400-500 acres in size. Since the War there has been a tendency for small holdings to disappear and for farming units to increase in size.
